page.title: 06PIERS
page.content: {Shanklin Pier was completed in 1891 {and Sandown Pier was completed in 1907.They were both built as tourists attractions in Victorian times.The main structure of the piers is iron and wood.As the piers deteriorate they become increasingly expensive to maintain.Both piers remain tourist attractions despite an entry fee of 10p at Shanklin. Shanklin and Sandown piers have many attractions today.Each has a theatre, Sandown theatre being the larger and attracting famous stars,whereas Shanklin is smaller and ofen used for local functions.Each has an amusement arcade and cafe of some kind.There are facilities for fishing at the end of each pier.
